definition: the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲

sentences.english: But for Jared, wealth and living standards have diverged.
sentences.chinese: 但是对于贾里德，财富和生活水平已经背离了。

sentences.english: Japan's military power has been derogating the Peaceful Constitution on and on.
sentences.chinese: 日本军事力量逐渐背离和平宪法。

sentences.english: No. 8 T-bag: You think you are the only one who feels betrayed?
sentences.chinese: 你以为只有你认为被人背离了吗？

sentences.english: Wang xiaobo depart from Duras, and trends towards Calvino.
sentences.chinese: 王小波背离了杜拉斯，而走向了卡尔维诺。

sentences.english: Large, complex enterprises may often have good reasons for deviating from some of the recommendations.
sentences.chinese: 大型的复杂企业可能通常有背离这些建议的充分理由。

sentences.english: He believed that society turned people into something that they weren’t born to be.
sentences.chinese: 他相信，社会在把人拖向背离人的本性的那一端。

sentences.english: Forex markets and equities have diverged today.
sentences.chinese: 外汇市场与股市今天走势背离。

sentences.english: It was well-meaning advice but it was polar opposite of the truth.
sentences.chinese: 这种建议的意向是好的，但却彻底背离了事实。

sentences.english: However, from the jurisprudence point of view, it deviates from the spirit of conviction according to the law.
sentences.chinese: 但从法理学角度看，“严打”与罪刑法定精神相背离。

sentences.english: Americans turned away from Republican rule in the election of nineteen thirty-two.
sentences.chinese: 美国人背离了共和党统治的一九三二年选举。

sentences.english: The ecological environment crisis has resulted from the fact that science deviates from humanities.
sentences.chinese: 科学与人文的背离是诱发生态环境危机的文化根源。

sentences.english: Cabaret, as filmed by Fosse, focused chillingly on the disparity between reality and illusion.
sentences.chinese: 福斯将电影尖锐的焦点对准了现实和幻想的背离。

sentences.english: That's why comet tails always point away from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么彗尾总是背离太阳的方向。

sentences.english: Serve, do not disserve the human.
sentences.chinese: 以服务人民为荣，已背离人民为耻。

sentences.english: But Gayla's emphasis on personal style goes way beyond just the basics.
sentences.chinese: 但Gayla强调的个人风格和基础是背离的。

sentences.english: If education rejects morals, it can also become a social danger.
sentences.chinese: 教育背离了道德，就会变成摧残人性的社会公害。

definition: bull market (prices appear to be rising)
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
to fall back (of water level or share prices)
reversal/inversion/to reverse/to invert (upside down, inside out, back to front, white to black etc)
turning point/breaking point/inflexion point (math., a point of a curve at which the curvature changes sign)
